list_definition.definition: a long upright pole especially for carrying the sails of a ship, an aerial, flag etc

list_ex_of_english: I share that frustration given the number of masts that have been sited in my constituency.
There is no clear evidence of any directly harmful health effects caused by mobile phone masts.
Such towers and masts are growing faster than leylandii, and are now being erected close to many private houses.
I think the answer is very definitely that we have to have regard to the amenities of the places where we erect these masts.
As a result of these decisions six masts were built during this period, four in 2000 and two in 2001.
We must be transparent about where the masts are placed.
The authority will be able to take any representations into account when considering whether to grant or refuse approval to the mast's siting and appearance.
Overall, it is desirable to keep the number of telecommunications masts to a minimum, whether operative or redundant.
